overview:
## Discussion

Use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/performBatchUpdates(_:completion:)] method instead of this one whenever possible.

You call this method to bracket a series of method calls that begins with [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/beginUpdates()] and that consists of operations to insert, delete, select, and reload rows and sections of the table view. When you call `endUpdates`, `UITableView` animates the operations simultaneously. Invocations of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/beginUpdates()] and `endUpdates` can be nested. If you don’t make the insertion, deletion, and selection calls inside this block, table attributes such as row count can become invalid.

# endUpdates()

**Instance Method**

Concludes a series of method calls that insert, delete, select, or reload rows and sections of the table view.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func endUpdates()
```

## Discussion

Use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/performBatchUpdates(_:completion:)] method instead of this one whenever possible.

You call this method to bracket a series of method calls that begins with [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/beginUpdates()] and that consists of operations to insert, delete, select, and reload rows and sections of the table view. When you call `endUpdates`, `UITableView` animates the operations simultaneously. Invocations of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UITableView/beginUpdates()] and `endUpdates` can be nested. If you don’t make the insertion, deletion, and selection calls inside this block, table attributes such as row count can become invalid.

## Performing batch updates to rows and sections

- **performBatchUpdates(_:completion:)**: Animates multiple insert, delete, reload, and move operations as a group.
- **beginUpdates()**: Begins a series of method calls that insert, delete, or select rows and sections of the table view.
